label: 一期
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: One generation. Used to connote a limited inheritance period for female heirs. To prevent portions of a house's patrimony from falling into alien hands, land rights granted to female heirs were required to revert to the main line after the recipient's death; hence "life tenure." (See Mass, Kamakura Bakufu) "
